definition: to break through/to make a breakthrough/to surmount or break the back of (a task etc)/(of ball sports) to break through a defense
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: We broke through the border positions southwest of Kalwarya.
sentences.chinese: 我们突破了卡尔沃亚西南的边境阵地。

sentences.english: High viscosity oils produce foam with small bubbles that do not break easily.
sentences.chinese: 高粘度油产生泡沫的小气泡，不容易突破。

sentences.english: Wang Lei's sharp break in the Moco and the formation of the basket with even 4 hours.
sentences.chinese: 王磊犀利的突破和莫科在篮下形成配合连得4分。

sentences.english: Later came the first break in their restored home circle. The Dovecote
sentences.chinese: 不久，他们重新团聚起来的家就发生了第一次突破。

sentences.english: You can break through and challenge your crystallized patterns and mind-sets.
sentences.chinese: 你可以突破和挑战你的固化模式和心态。

sentences.english: His final breakthrough came when he obtained a copy of a manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 贾维斯最终在一份手稿上的复印件上找到了突破口。

sentences.english: In fact, the mankind have been aring set up a network of break the space and time restriction.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，人类一直在构建突破空间与时间限制的网络。

sentences.english: The theoretical breakthrough of plutonomy originated basically from the breakthrough of productivity.
sentences.chinese: 政治经济学的理论发展根源于生产力的突破。

sentences.english: The southern San Andreas Fault is considered "most primed to break".
sentences.chinese: 南部的圣安德里亚斯断层被认为是“最引突破”。

sentences.english: See the top 10 medical breakthroughs of 2009.
In 2008, the company exports exceeded $ 100 million.
sentences.chinese: 2008年，公司出口创汇突破1亿美元。

sentences.english: The study of modern lexicology has made great breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 现代词汇学已经获得了较大的突破。

sentences.english: The fuel battery become one of way solves this cause in many customers mind.
sentences.chinese: 要突破这样的瓶颈，燃料电池就成了众望所归。

sentences.english: Artificial insemination was a significant breakthrough in panda conservation.
sentences.chinese: 人工受精是熊猫保护领域的重大突破。

sentences.english: Menses become irregular, and heavy breakthrough bleeding can occur.
sentences.chinese: 月经变得不规则，会发生严重的突破性出血。

sentences.english: And we’re on the edge of a truly great breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在正身处一个重大的突破的边缘。

definition: strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
high position/eminent status/top job/raised position/upper (limbs)/a high (i.e. local maximum)/high point on scale, high grade, temperature, latitude etc
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to press on towards/to close in on/to approach/to draw near
